qas.question: What are the Members of classes of the Order assigned to?

answers.text: positions in the order of precedence

qas.question: Who of the male members feature on the order?

answers.text: Wives of male members of all classes also feature on the order of precedence, as do sons, daughters and daughters-in-law

qas.question: Who are not assigned any special precedence?

answers.text: relatives of Ladies of the Order

qas.question: Who can individuals derive precedence from?
Who can individuals can not derive precedence from?

context: Members of all classes of the Order are assigned <a0_0>positions in the order of precedence<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Wives of male members of all classes also feature on the order of precedence, as do sons, daughters and daughters-in-law<a1_0/> of Knights Grand Cross and Knights Commander; <a2_0>relatives of Ladies of the Order<a2_0/>, however, are not assigned any special precedence. As a general rule, individuals can derive precedence from their <a3_0>fathers or husbands<a3_0/>, but not from their <a4_0>mothers or wives<a4_0/> (see order of precedence in England and Wales for the exact positions).
